intro: Lathyrus alpestris var. skorpili, commonly known as the Alpine grass vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, and it has slender, climbing stems with trifoliate leaves. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and slopes. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in arid or disturbed soils.
